nodes.name: onlyContractOwner

nodes.documentation: @dev In order to avoid any complications that might arise from the fact that mining takes 10 to 20 seconds (such as frontrunning), the modifier has a wiggle room of 5 minutes. It's an extra precaution that might not be needed since you can only specify up to the day in the application UI

devdoc.author: John Park

params._ecAesKey: Encrypted AES key -> AES key is used to encrypt the image. Public RSA key is used to encyrpt the AES key. Private RSA key is used to decrpt the encrypted AES key
params._ipfs: IPFS hash of the encrypted image
params._privKey: Private RSA key -> AES key is used to encrypt the image. Public RSA key is used to encyrpt the AES key. Private RSA key is used to decrpt the encrypted AES key
params._unlockTime: The time when an encrypted image is able to be decrypted (Unix timestamp in seconds)

getTotalEntries().author: John Park
getTotalEntries().return: Total number of Entries in the contract

params._id: The Entry id. Used to identify which image is to be marked as ready to be decrypted

devdoc.title: A digital time capsule for images

appendEntry(uint256,string,string,string.notice: Stores key pieces of information for an encrypted image

circuitBreaker().notice: Flips the value of contractPaused state variable so that the circuit breaker modifier kicks in

close().notice: Kill the contract so that it's no longer accessible

getEntry(uint256).notice: Fetches an Entry using _id as the unique identifier

getSenderEntries().notice: Fetches an array of all of the message sender's Entries

getTotalEntries().notice: Fetches the total number of Entries stored in the contract

release(uint256).notice: Checks if it's time to decrypt an image by marking a boolean

userdoc.notice: This smart contract's main purpose is to store the state for an image time capsule application. Along with basic inifo like unlock time, title, etc, private key used to encrypt the AES key and the encrypted AES key is stored for each entry
